manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Cuisinart Chef's Classic Stainless Steel The 5.5 Quart Sauté Pan with Helper Handle & Cover is a supremely versatile pan twith high, straight sides and the flat cooking surface to maximize capacity. Sear meats, poultry and more; cover to simmer for a perfect finish with convenient measurement markings so you know exactly how much food you are preparing.

Features - Chef's Choice Stainless: Mirror finish. Classic looks, professional performance - Unsurpassed Heat Distribution: Aluminum encapsulated base heats quickly and spreads heat evenly. Eliminates hot spots - Cool Grip Handle: Solid stainless steel riveted handle stays cool on the stovetop. A helper handle provides extra support and balance when lifting and pouring - Drip-Free Pouring: Rim is tapered for drip-free pouring - Flavor Lock Lid: Tight-fitting cover seals in moisture and nutrients for healthier, more flavorful results, every time you cook - Dishwasher Safe: Premium stainless steel easily cleans to original brilliant finish - Stainless Steel for Professional Results: Stainless steel cooking surface does not discolor, react with food or alter flavors. Great for classic cooking techniques like slow simmers, rolling boils and reduction of liquids

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent and versatile pan
reviews.reviewText: I bought this pan to see if I can use stainless steel and this is phenomenal. This pan is so versatile. I can make chicken, braise beef short ribs, sauté and do so much more. This is great for one pot meals. It arrived in perfect condition. It is easy to clean. I let the pan cool then fill it with water. Most of the time I can clean it right away after using no problem.. I don’t have any issues cleaning my stainless steel pans. It’s nonstick if you use it properly. I use medium to low medium heat. That’s more then enough heat to get a nice braise or sear because of how well this heats up. Heat distribution is also good. I’ll be switching over to an all stainless steel set in the future. This is very well made. I scratched the bottom but that was my fault and it still looks beautiful. It’s on the bottom and nobody can even see it. It holds up. Is very sturdy and can fit a lot of food as you can see I fit a whole butterfly chicken. It looks so nice. Great price. I took a picture of the pot after I used and cleaned it a few times. I’ll get barkeepers friend to keep them shiny and new looking. I hand wash and dry right away to preserve them. This is going to last a long time I hope.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent pan for the price
reviews.reviewText: I'm an avid cook and frequently use cast iron and stainless cookware. I needed a good saute pan and I was seeing prices close to the two hundred mark for the good, well known brands. I also saw the extreme of thirty dollar pans that were very light and extremely thin. I saw the Cuisinart Chef's Classic for under sixty dollars and saw the good reviews it had. I purchased it and I'm glad I did. It is not as heavy duty as Al-Clad and some of the high end brands, BUT it is considerably more robust than the cheaper pans. I cook on a gas stove and find that this pan heats up really well on a medium-high setting and doesn't have the hot spot like my cast iron pans have. Chunks of meat will brown evenly throughout the pan and I don't have to rotate pieces in and out of the hot spot like I do on the cast iron pans. This pan is a great size. I use it to cook for 3-4 people and can easily load it up to serve twice that many. Very versatile and easy to clean. I love using this pan for stews and such where I can brown the meat, saute vegetables and then add water and seasoning and let it simmer for a while. The lid fits well and the helper handle is a nice feature for when the pan is loaded down and is heavy. Even though only the bottom has the aluminum core, I find that it cooks very well and has good heat retention. The other brands are heavier and I'm sure are great for professionals, but for me, I think this this pan is awesome and I'll take the extra hundred dollars I saved and buy more cookware like this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Purchased Jan of 2013 & still going strong
reviews.reviewText: No pictures on this initial review of this item. Just know that after 10, almost 11 years, this is a durable, and sizable sauté pan. I use this for family dishes and it's my favorite for a variety of multi-ingredient pasta dishes I make. It holds a huge amount of food to feed the entire family. It heats evenly and cleans up well. Stainless construction means you can cook healthy with no unusual coating concerns. And lastly, the rivets that hold the handles on the pan and stainless lid are just as tight as when the pan was new. And yes, this pan gets used weekly, and is definitely not babied.We're thrilled to have this 5.5 Qt saute pan and cannot recommend it enough.This is a solid 5-star item.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Once again, Cuisinart hits a home run, this was just what I needed as a replacement for a Calphalon pan. So many dishes you can prepare with this, and the price is incredible. The quality is excellent, and very easy cleanup, this is why I keep buying Cuisinart products, they just work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars decent, mine arrived warped, can be fixed
reviews.reviewText: When it arrived, it was warped upwards at the center, causing oil to run to the edges of the pan instead of spreading out equally, and the opposite for heat distribution I guess. Hard to tell about heat since I was making a sauce (pizza sauce, using homegrown tomatos; saute garlic in oil first, before adding the previously blanched tomatoes and spices, and simmering for 30 minutes or so, then cool and puree).After I cleaned the pan, I took it outside and beat it (thorougly) with a rubber mallet until it seemed flat.Tested it today ( I made the pizza sauce and used the pan for the first time yesterday), sauteeing some mushrooms (pizza topping). Idk if it's perfectly flat after I "fixed" it, but oil and seemingly heat both spread evenly across the pan now.It didn't warp back up while sauteeing the mushrooms, so it must've been some manufacturing defect or maybe I recieved someone else's return, idk. Or maybe damaged during shipping.In any case, I think I'll be pretty happy with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars You won't be dissapointed
reviews.reviewText: This hands down was one of my best purchases for 2023! This is the perfect pan size for pan frying chicken as all of your chicken will fit in there all at one time. The distribution of heat also made it an excellent pan while make sauce for a large group of people. I would definitely repurchase this item.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This pan works even better than non stick pans and is big enough to hold most recipes. Keep in mind for anyone who does not know stainless steel, make sure you YouTube how to properly heat it up cause I can promise you, if you follow those directions, nothing will ever stick and 9 out of 10 times it's incredibly easy to clean with little to no effort required

Estupendo sartén, muy amplio y cocina muy parejo en cualquier punto donde se coloquen los alimentos. Es la mejor opción para una familia que necesite cocinar porciones amplias. Es un bello e útil sartén.

Used it once so far. Seems to distribute heat evenly and was relatively easy to clean. It does seem to be a little heavy because it is 5 qt's and quite thick on the bottom. If weight would be a problem, consider the 3 qt size in the same product.
La caja del producto llegó muy dañada. De suerte que el sartén no se alcanzó a dañar, pues el mando venía por fuera.
It's great! I use it for everything except eggs. Feels heavy duty and it is built to last. Even has a lifetime warranty!
I just received my new pan & I love it & can't wait to use it.
